newsPage.title: US Tour: Training in Central Park
newsPage.TitleOne: Our latest session took place in one of New York’s most iconic locations…
newsPage.DescOne:
Pep Guardiola took the squad over to train on Central Park ahead of our pre-season friendly with AC Milan on Saturday evening.

The players were put through their paces with some running drills and light ball exercises, with New York’s skyscrapers providing a truly unique backdrop.

City face the Italian giants at Yankee Stadium, with kick-off set for 18:00 (EDT).
newsPage.DescTwo:
It represents the second of four friendlies the team will be involved in during our tour of the United States, with Pep Guardiola’s men having already faced Celtic in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.

After locking horns with AC Milan, further clashes with FC Barcelona in Orlando, Florida and Chelsea in Columbus, Ohio will follow.

But for now, all eyes are on Saturday, as the players sharpened up in Central Park - New York’s famous green space situated in the very heart of the city.

newsPage.title: CITY EDGED OUT IN SEVEN-GOAL CELTIC THRILLER
GUARDIOLA GIVES TRANSFER UPDATE
newsPage.TitleOne: Pep Guardiola says wholesale changes to his Manchester City squad are unlikely during the current transfer window.
newsPage.DescOne:
City have made one signing so far this summer, with 20-year-old winger Savinho joining the club on a five-year deal.

Guardiola admits there’s always a chance there could be incomings but says he is comfortable with his options and feels he has a good blend of talent and personality in his squad, which he feels is difficult to replace.

“If someone leaves, we are going to talk about that and, of course, until the last day [of the transfer window] we have chances,” he said in a press conference ahead of our first pre-season Tour match against Celtic at the Keenan Memorial Stadium in Chapel Hill, North Carolina on Tuesday.

 “I don’t rule out new players as an option, but I think there is an 85, 90, 95% chance we will have the same squad.”

Meanwhile the boss says Kevin De Bruyne will remain at City this season amid reports of an exit.

“Kevin isn’t leaving,” Guardiola said.
newsPage.DescTwo:
City face Celtic, AC Milan, Barcelona and Chelsea during the Club’s pre-season tour of the United States.

As always, mancity.com and the official app are the best places to keep across all things City during our time in the US.

Including pre-match press conferences and live open training as well as detailed and varied in-game and post-friendly coverage of all our fixtures, our website and app provide fans with a complete City experience, all from one handy place.

newsPage.title: INSIDE CITY EPISODE 468: CITY BEGIN OUR US TOUR!
CITY 3-4 CELTIC: EXTENDED HIGHLIGHTS
newsPage.TitleOne: Manchester City's pre-season tour of the United States began with a 4-3 defeat to Celtic in North Carolina.
newsPage.DescOne:
A first half brace from Nicolas Kuhn and smart Kyogo Furuhashi finish meant City went in behind at the break despite Oscar Bobb also finding the net.

With Celtic’s Scottish Premier League season getting under way in just over one week, their extra sharpness initially told in the Kenan Memorial Stadium’s North Carolina heat.

A defiant second half display, spearheaded by the irrepressible Bobb, pulled City level though with Maximo Perrone and Erling Haaland both on target, but the Scottish champions found a winner through substitute Luis Palma.

It was harsh on City, but the sight of academy products Jahmai Simpson-Pusey, Jadel Katongo, Joel Ndala and Nico O’Reilly all making their senior debuts provided a major positive in our pre-season opener.

 Enjoy the best of the action by playing the video above...

newsPage.title: 12 ACADEMY PLAYERS SIGN SCHOLARSHIPS
Guardiola: Bobb has incredible potential
FODEN NAMED PREMIER LEAGUE PLAYER OF THE SEASON
City on Tour Episode One: North Carolina
newsPage.TitleOne: Re-watch our Pitchside Live show from our open training session in North Carolina.
newsPage.DescOne:
Oscar Bobb and Pep Guardiola faced the media ahead of our clash with Celtic.

Training took place at North Carolina Courage’s WakeMed Stadium soon after, as the squad were put through their paces in front of the travelling City fans.

Presenter FG joined City legends Shaun Wright-Phillips and Joleon Lescott from pitch side, soaking up the atmosphere and discussing our pre-season tour so far.
newsPage.DescTwo:
City face Celtic, AC Milan, Barcelona and Chelsea during the Club’s pre-season tour of the United States.

newsPage.title: Gallery: Recovery after Celtic clash
Guardiola happy with North Carolina leg of US Tour
GVARDIOL AND KOVACIC TO JOIN UP WITH CITY IN NEW YORK
newsPage.TitleOne: Josko Gvardiol and Mateo Kovacic are set to join up with the Manchester City squad in New York on the second leg of our 2024 USA Tour.
newsPage.DescOne:
The Croatian pair were given extra time off after playing at the European Championship in the summer.

They will now meet up with Pep Guardiola and their team-mates ahead of our second match with AC Milan at New York’s Yankee Stadium on July 27.

City then move on to Orlando where we play Barcelona at the Camping World Stadium on 30 July before our final game against Chelsea at Ohio Stadium on 3 August.

All our players that featured at EURO 2024 or the Copa America in the United States, have been given time to recuperate from a long season.

Gvardiol and Kovacic played in all of Croatia’s group games against Spain, Albania and Italy.
newsPage.DescTwo:
They were the only City players that didn’t make it into the knockout stage in Germany after a last-minute equaliser in their final match against Italy saw them suffer late heartbreak.

After joining 12 months ago, both players made a big impact as we secured a record fourth Premier League title in a row as well as winning the European Super Cup and Club World Cup.

Playing at left-back, Gvardiol scored five goals in the final weeks of the season as we won our last 10 games to claim the title.
